title: Cunningham Project
summary: The Cunningham Project is a collaborative effort started in 1925 to factor numbers of the form  bn Â± 1 for b = 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 10, 11, 12 and large n. The project is named after Allan Joseph Champneys Cunningham, who published the first version of the table together with Herbert J. Woodall.[1] There are three printed versions of the table, the most recent published in 2002,[2] as well as an online version.[3]
